levels.question: What band sang this? 'Cause I want it that way'

levels.question: Cornell University was founded in this year
levels.hint: An eventful time in American history, this year saw the end of the civil war, and the assassination of Abraham Lincoln.

levels.question: On the morning of October 8, 1997, this peculiar object was found atop McGraw Tower.
levels.hint: This object was very seasonal for the spooky month of October.

levels.question: What is Cornell University's oldest building?
levels.hint: This arts quad building, home to the linguistics department, is also under heavy renovations this year.

levels.question: Ezra Cornell, in addition to founding Cornell University, helped found this financial service company.
levels.hint: Originally a telegraph company, it now mostly serves as a money transfer service.

levels.question: Complete: 'May the _____ be with you'.
levels.hint: This quote is from Star Wars.

levels.question: Complete: 'Mama always said life was like a box of _____. You never know what you're gonna get'.
levels.hint: A brown and sweet snack.

levels.question: Who said this? 'Program testing can at best show the presence of errors but never their absence.'
levels.hint: A Dutch programmer who invented an algorithm for finding the shortest paths between nodes in a graph.

levels.question: Which movie/book is this quote from? 'It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.'
answers: harry potter and the goblet of fire
levels.hint: The fourth of a series of fantasy novels featuring a young wizard.

levels.question: Which movie is this quote from? 'I'm going to make him an offer he can't refuse.'
levels.hint: A famous mob drama.

levels.hint: It's the movie featuring lions.

levels.hint: The villian in the movie this princess is featured in is Maleficient.

levels.hint: The country is next to Sweden.

levels.question: This state is the most populous state in the country.
levels.hint: This west coast state is also home to the second largest city in the country.

levels.question: This state contains the highest mountain in the country.
levels.hint: This is also the largest state by area.

levels.question: Which of these states were not a part of the original 13 colonies: Georgia, Delaware, Maine, New Hampshire?
levels.hint: It's not Georgia!

levels.question: The territory currently comprising Washington DC was formerly part of this state.
levels.hint: This state is also known for their blue crabs.

levels.question: This state is the only state to have a unicameral state legislature.
levels.hint: this midwestern state's capitol is Lincoln.

levels.question: Many know the 49th and 50th state (Alaska and Hawaii), but this state was the 48th state to join the country.
levels.hint: This state was also formerly a part of Mexico.

levels.question: What is a baby whale called
levels.hint: It is also the name of a body part.

levels.question: What animal can turn its head almost 360 degrees?
levels.hint: This animals is portrayed as wise.

levels.question: How many stomach(es) does a cow have?
levels.hint: It has more than one

levels.question: What type of feather keep birds warm?
levels.hint: Used in some jackets.

levels.question: Christmas is celebrated on ____ December each year.
levels.hint: It's a week before New Year's Day.

levels.question: Holi is a Hindu festival that is known as the 'Celebration of _____'
levels.hint: Traffic Lights have 3 of them.

levels.question: What is made at the start of every new year?
levels.hint: It is often broken.

levels.question: During Halloween, what is a carved pumpkin with a light in it called?
levels.hint: 'Name'+'o'+'Something you put a light in'.

levels.question: Which century was Thanksgiving first celebrated?
levels.hint: It is a prime number.

levels.question: Saint Patrick was a missionary in which country?
levels.hint: Dublin is its largest city.

levels.question: Who composed the piece Für Elise?
levels.hint: Famous German composer and pianist who is a crucial figure in the transition between the Classical and Romantic eras in Classical music.

levels.question: Who arranged The Hungarian Dances?
levels.hint: One of the 'Three Bs' of music, born into a Lutheren family.

levels.question: What is Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky's famous holiday classical piece?
levels.hint: A favorite Christmas time ballet.

levels.question: What is György Ligeti's classical piece featured in the movie 'The Shining'?
levels.hint: This piece is also featured in Scorsese's 'Shutter Island'.

levels.question: Who composed the Goldberg Variations, and also became blind?
levels.hint: He was known as a outstanding organ player and technician.

levels.question: A distinguished composer and pianist of the Romantic era who was the first to perform publicly any work by Brahms, notably the Variations and Fugue on a Theme by Handel.
levels.hint: She was married to Robert Schumann.

levels.question: Dutch computer science Edsger Dijkstra is most well known for developing an algorithm to compute this.
levels.hint: Covered in CS 2110, this algorithm is used in various mapping programs

levels.question: This person was responsible for creating much of the theoretical foundations of computer science, along with cracking a nazi war code in the second world war.
levels.hint: The movie The Imitation Game is based on his life.

levels.question: Often considered the first computer programmer, in the 19th century this person designed a computer algorithm to compute Bernoulli numbers.
levels.hint: This woman is also the daughter of a renowned english poet, Lord Byron

levels.question: This person developed lambda calculus, a basis for expressing computation, the basis for functional programming languages.
levels.hint: Working at princeton at the same time as Turing was completing his work on computation, their theories were ultimately equivalent, resulting in the ___-Turing thesis.

levels.question: The Colosseum is found in which city?
levels.hint: It is the capital city of Italy.

levels.question: This landmark is the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
levels.hint: A 3D triangle!

levels.question: Machu Picchu was built by which Civilization?
levels.hint: This civilization was centered in Peru.

levels.question: The Eiffel Tower surpassed which man-made structure to become the tallest in the world?
levels.hint: It was built to commemorate the commander-in-chief of the Continental Army.

levels.question: How many (official) planets are in our solar system?
levels.hint: Pluto is not considered a planet.

levels.question: 95% of all matter in the universe is invisible, and is called ___
levels.hint: There is no light.

levels.question: Which is the hottest planet in the solar system?
levels.hint: ___ fly trap.

levels.hint: It is an even number .

levels.hint: This artist also produces his own clothing line, most notably for sneakers.

levels.hint: It was built to commemorate the commander-in-chief of the Continental Army.

levels.hint: The answer contains Mexico.
